definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: Billions of apps have been downloaded from Apple 's ( AAPL - news - people ) App Store alone.
sentences.chinese: 已有数以亿计的应用从苹果的应用程序商店中被下载。

sentences.english: Their actions have wiped off billions of dollars in their companies' market capitalisations.
sentences.chinese: 他们的行为也使公司蒙受了数以亿计的损失。

sentences.english: It conducts hundreds of millions of searches every day.
sentences.chinese: 它每天进行数以亿计的搜索。

sentences.english: there are hundreds of millions of people on this planet who have been left behind.
sentences.chinese: 在这个星球上，还有数以亿计的人被抛在后面。

sentences.english: Their actions have wiped off billions of dollars in their companies" market capitalisations."
sentences.chinese: 他们也使公司蒙受了数以亿计的损失。

definition: lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
over one billion/more than a billion
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
